title: Ticket #6768: Changes to defaults for end of 8.7 series
description:
This ticket is for tracking proposed changes to the default values of configuration parameters before the 8.8 stable series.

Append your ideas below with your name by each item.

HTCondor Param Table Changes

Here are proposed changes that likely just involve settings in the param table.

  1. Incorporate settings from CMS global pool (Jaime) [Done]
    • =COLLECTOR_MAX_FILE_DESCRIPTORS=81920= (currently 10240)
      Higher limit fails in macOS tests
    • NEGOTIATOR_MAX_TIME_PER_SUBMITTER=60 (currently 31536000)
    • NEGOTIATOR_MAX_TIME_PER_PIESPIN=120 (currently 31536000)
    • =NEGOTIATOR_TIMEOUT=5= (currently 30)
      consider for 8.9
    • NEGOTIATOR_MAX_TIME_PER_CYCLE=1200 (currently (31536000)
    • NEGOTIATOR_MAX_TIME_PER_SCHEDD=120 (currently 31536000)
    • FILE_TRANSFER_DISK_LOAD_THROTTLE=2.0 (currently unset)
    • MAX_CONCURRENT_UPLOADS=100 (currently 10)
    • MAX_CONCURRENT_DOWNLOADS=100 (currently 10)
    • CURB_MATCHMAKING=(ShadowsRunning > .97*$(MAX_JOBS_RUNNING)) || (RecentDaemonCoreDutyCycle > 0.98) (currently unset) -- See also #5192 (group recommends dropping MAX_JOBS_RUNNING portion)
  2. Enable negotiator prefetch (Jaime) [Done]
    • NEGOTIATOR_PREFETCH_REQUESTS=TRUE
    • NEGOTIATOR_RESOURCE_REQUEST_LIST_SIZE=200
    • NEGOTIATOR_PREFETCH_REQUESTS_MAX_TIME=60
  3. Set SCHEDD_ALLOW_LATE_MATERIALIZE=True (TJ) [Done]
  4. Set MOUNT_UNDER_SCRATCH="/tmp,/var/tmp" -- note the double quotes! (ToddT) [Done]
  5. Set USE_PID_NAMESPACES=True (ToddT)
    • This should be an 8.9 change
  6. Set WARN_ON_UNUSED_SUBMIT_FILE_MACROS=True (ToddT) [Done]
  7. Set a reasonable default for RESERVED_MEMORY, RESERVED_SWAP, and RESERVED_DISK. Zero is not a reasonable default. :) (ToddT)
    • RESERVED_DISK=0 is reasonable when EXECUTE is on its own partition
    • Deferred to 8.9. The group had no idea what a reasonable default would be, and any non-zero default for memory would confuse admins looking at condor_status.

  8. Set =MAX_JOBS_RUNNING=MIN({2*$(DETECTED_MEMORY), 10000})= Recent observations show shadow PSS of 500kB (Jaime)
    Committing all of memory to shadows is overly aggressive
  9. Set =SENDMAIL=/usr/sbin/sendmail= (Jaime)
    ToddT disagrees with this suggestion, since the code calls param_with_full_path() on the value of the SENDMAIL knob
  10. Set HISTORY_HELPER_MAX_CONCURRENCY=50. Current default is 2. Why? The schedd calls Create_Process() to handle this, and the default is to clone, so why such a crazy low limit??? (ToddT) [Done]
  11. DAGMan and Scheduler Universe changes (Mark) [Done]
    • DAGMAN_MAX_SUBMITS_PER_INTERVAL=100
    • MAX_RUNNING_SCHEDULER_JOBS_PER_OWNER=200
    • START_SCHEDULER_UNIVERSE=TotalSchedulerJobsRunning < 500
  12. =USE_PSS=True= (Jaime)
    -- Group objected to PSS value being reported for job's MemoryUsage
  13. Reduce default for DEFAULT_JOB_MAX_RETRIES (currently 10) #6787

Add metaknobs

  1. StaticSlots(<min_cpus>[,<min_memory>]) (TJ)
    • Defer to 8.9

Remove Cruft

  1. Get rid of condor_history_helper binary (ToddT) Already done #6247
  2. Get rid of condor_lease_manager binary and documentation (ToddT) (TimT) [Done]
  3. Get rid of all the #pragma messages littering the build output (ToddT) (TJ) [Done]
  4. Get rid of stork (TimT) [Done]

Slightly more involved HTCondor changes

Here are proposed changes that may involve more than just setting defaults in the param table. These are all deferred to 8.9.

  1. Change ENABLE_USERLOG_FSYNC default to False, unless it is the job event log specified for use by condor_dagman, in which case default to True. (ToddT)
  2. Have condor_dagman write its workflow event log into the SPOOL directory for the dagman job. (ToddT)
  3. Keep only dagman event logs in the schedd userlog cache and have USERLOG_FILE_CACHE_MAX default to something much larger than zero?!? (ToddT)

Optional configuration

  1. When installing condor-small-shadow, drop a config.d file to automatically use it. [Done]
remarks:
2018-Sep-24 14:59:09 by tlmiller:
I have no actual suggestions; my observations follow.

daemoncore/utils

A look through the param() calls in these sections codes revealed the following knobs of interest:

  • WANT_UDP_COMMAND_SOCKET

This seems like it should be off for everything except for collectors in a collector tree, but making that change will break existing collector tree setups. Maybe we could knob this off in the general case but back on for collectors in general? Not sure about the consequences here.

  • MAX_ACCEPTS_PER_CYCLE

I have no idea why this is 8. IIRC, there as a big stink about this several years ago; it was intended to improve latency, I believe?

  • COLLECTOR_SOCKET_BUFSIZE

This is set to 10,000 k. That sounds awfully arbitrary, and it's unclear that there's a good reason (on Linux) for not looking it up in /proc/sys/net/core/rmem_max and just using that (unless the limit there is like, all of system memory, maybe).

2018-Sep-25 16:38:09 by coatsworth:
I've proposed increasingly a few DAGMan and Scheduler Universe limits. I did some profiling and found that while a small (single job) DAGMan has a higher memory footprint than expected (~8 MB), much of this memory is shared between processes and subsequent small DAGMans only cost ~2 MB. Also increasing the number of jobs is relatively cheap (<1 KB/job) so a DAG with 10,000 jobs doesn't cost much more than a single job.

The numbers I've proposed are somewhat arbitrary and generally just a doubling of the existing defaults. Open for discussion if anyone disagrees with them.
